intro: Distictella pulverulenta, commonly known as the dustwort, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine, powdery hairs. Distictella pulverulenta is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in challenging conditions.
